Thank you to everyone who donated to Michael Phelps Foundation's water-safety campaign! 

We exceeded the campaign goal of $22,000, which will help us expand the reach of the im program to 39 Boys & Girls Clubs of America, including the newest Club ‚Äì Metro Baltimore. I met with children from Boys and Girls Clubs of Metropolitan Baltimore (BGCMB) today and spoke with them about overcoming my own fear of the water, and then helped lead an #imsafe lesson that focuses on becoming comfortable in the water. Thank you to my hometown team, the Baltimore Ravens, for your generous donation that helped us bring water-safety instruction to this Metro Baltimore Club. It was great to see the children having fun in the water today!

This month, Michael Phelps Foundation, Michael Phelps Swim School and KidsHealth are teaming up to keep kids safe. Here are my top swim safety tips:

1.    Get lessons if you don‚Äôt know how to swim.
2.    Remember the buddy system. Never swim alone. Always swim with other people.
3.    At the beach or pool, only swim if the lifeguard is on duty.
4.    Look before you leap: Make sure the water is deep enough, especially for diving and make sure you don‚Äôt jump on top of someone!

The past three months of my life have been some of the hardest times I‚Äôve ever gone through, and the biggest learning experience that I've ever had. As I hoped, I learned a lot about myself during my time away and now have the tools to continue to learn and grow from all of this. What I did was wrong and I will share my experience with others and hope that I can help make a difference.
I know I still have work to do but I have great support around me and look forward to a brighter future. I am back in the pool training and have set new goals for myself in and out of swimming for 2015 and beyond. I'm so thankful for those who have supported me during this difficult time in my life!!! I love you all!!

Earlier this morning, I was arrested and charged with DUI, excessive speeding and crossing double lane lines. I understand the severity of my actions and take full responsibility. I know these words may not mean much right now but I‚Äôm deeply sorry to everyone I have let down.
